entry.title: I Stopped Writing Blog Posts. Now AI Agents Do It For Me.
entry.summary: I used to spend 3 hours on each blog post. Now I spend 3 minutes reviewing what 4 AI agents wrote. The quality? Better than before.
entry.content:
I used to spend 3 hours on each blog post. Now I spend 3 minutes reviewing what 4 AI agents wrote. The quality? Better than before.

The Problem​

Content marketing is critical. Everyone knows this. But when you're running multiple businesses, it's always the first thing to get deprioritized.

Why? Because writing a decent blog post takes 2-4 hours of focused time. Social posts need consistent voice. Publishing requires manual deployment to multiple systems.

The result: Marketing gets pushed to "someday" while revenue-generating work takes priority.

The Solution: A Synthetic Marketing Agency​

I built a 4-agent content factory that turns business activity into publishable content:

AgentRoleOutput
StrategistAnalyzes my activity, picks topicsContent brief
CopywriterDrafts blog + social postsMarkdown drafts
EditorBrand voice check, quality assuranceApproved content
PublisherDeploys to Docusaurus + X.comPublished URLs

How It Works​

  1. I do actual work on my businesses
  2. The system logs significant wins to a manifest
  3. When I want content, Strategist reads the manifest and picks a topic
  4. Copywriter drafts based on my brand voice guide
  5. Editor reviews for quality
  6. Publisher posts to X.com and my blog
  7. I review and approve in ~3 minutes

The Stack​

  • Manifest Protocol: JSONL file tracking all business activity
  • Claude Code: Orchestrates the 4 agents
  • SuperChase API: Handles X.com posting via OAuth 1.0a
  • Docusaurus: Static blog generation

What I Learned​

The insight isn't "AI can write." Everyone knows that.

The insight is: AI agents with context write better than AI without context.

When the Strategist knows what I actually did this week, the Copywriter has real material to work with. The Editor knows my voice because it has my brand guide. The Publisher knows where to post.

Context is everything.

What's Next​

We're testing this across 4 businesses right now:

  • Scan2Plan (reality capture)
  • Studio C (production)
  • Chase Pierson TV (personal brand)
  • Tuthill Design (design methodology)

If the engagement holds and the quality stays high, I'm packaging this for other founders at $499/mo.

Want early access? DM me "AGENCY" on X.

This post was generated by the Synthetic Marketing Agency and reviewed by a human in 3 minutes.

entry.title: Introducing SuperChase - The AI Executive OS
entry.summary: Building a business is hard. Building multiple businesses simultaneously is harder. What if you had an AI partner that understood your entire operation?
entry.content:
Building a business is hard. Building multiple businesses simultaneously is harder. What if you had an AI partner that understood your entire operation?

That's why I built SuperChase.

The Problem​

Running Scan2Plan, Studio C, Tuthill Design, and Chase Pierson TV means context-switching constantly. Each business has its own:

  • Communication patterns
  • Decision frameworks
  • Client relationships
  • Strategic priorities

No single assistant - human or AI - could hold all of this context.

The Solution: Hub-and-Spoke Architecture​

SuperChase uses a hub-and-spoke architecture where:

  • The Hub (George) maintains central intelligence and routing
  • Spokes handle specific integrations (email, voice, tasks, social)
  • Memory persists context across conversations

This architecture means George can draft emails in my voice, prioritize tasks based on business impact, and even propose strategic pivots when metrics deviate from plan.

What's Next​

Over the coming weeks, I'll be sharing:

  • Technical deep-dives into the GST (Goal-Strategy-Tactic) framework
  • How the Governor system enables progressive AI autonomy
  • Integration patterns for multi-business operations

Follow along as we build the future of AI-augmented operations.

This post was co-authored by George, the AI at the heart of SuperChase.
